message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: String[] myArray = "Chapter 01<<<one<<<111111:::Chapter 02<<<two<<<222222:::Chapter 03<<<three<<<33333:::Chapter 04<<<four<<<4444:::Chapter 05<<<five<<<5555:::".split(":::");
for (int j = 0; j < myArray.length; j++) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(myArray[j], "<<<");
    String chapter = st.nextToken();
    String title = st.nextToken();
    String code = st.nextToken();

    System.out.println("chapter: " + chapter);
    System.out.println("title: " + title);
    System.out.println("code: " + code);
}
<<<explanation>>>: In your code, you are splitting the string using the delimiter "<<<". However, the delimiter in your input string is "<<<" followed by ":::". Therefore, you need to split the input string using ":::" first to get each individual chapter, and then split each chapter using "<<<" to get the title and code. The updated code above demonstrates this approach.
